title: Weatheria's Connection to Ancient Weather Technology
summary: Fans theorize that Weatheria's advanced weather manipulation technology may have connections to ancient civilizations or the Void Century, potentially linking to the Ancient Weapons' weather-controlling capabilities.
fullText: Some One Piece fans have speculated that the artificial sky island Weatheria and its advanced weather manipulation technology could be connected to ancient weather control systems from the Void Century. The theory suggests that the scientists of Weatheria may have discovered or reverse-engineered ancient technology, similar to how Vegapunk works with ancient discoveries. This could explain their ability to create an artificial sky island and manipulate weather on such a large scale. Later revelations about Nami potentially using Zeus in conjunction with Weatheria technology to counter Uranus (one of the Ancient Weapons) adds weight to this theory.
author: Various r/OnePiece users

title: Vegapunk Intentionally Left Technology for Future Discovery
summary: Theory that Dr. Vegapunk deliberately left his laboratory and experiments on Karakuri Island knowing that someone worthy would eventually find and utilize his abandoned work for good purposes.
fullText: Some fans theorize that Dr. Vegapunk's 'abandoned' laboratory on Karakuri Island wasn't truly abandoned but rather intentionally left behind as a treasure trove for future inventors and scientists. The theory suggests Vegapunk, being a genius, anticipated that his early work could benefit others and chose to leave it accessible rather than destroy it when he left for the World Government. Franky discovering and utilizing this technology could have been part of Vegapunk's grand design, especially given Vegapunk's later characterization as someone who wants his science to help people. The fact that the Marines guard it but don't remove it supports the idea that Vegapunk wanted it preserved for future use.
author: One Piece theory community

title: Kuma's Strategic Placement of the Straw Hats
summary: Theory that Bartholomew Kuma didn't randomly scatter the Straw Hats but strategically sent each member to locations where they could grow stronger and gain specific knowledge needed for the New World.
fullText: A popular fan theory suggests that when Bartholomew Kuma used his Nikyu Nikyu no Mi powers to scatter the Straw Hat Pirates, he didn't send them to random locations but carefully chose each destination based on what that crew member needed to grow stronger. Nami being sent to Weatheria to learn advanced weather manipulation, Franky sent to Vegapunk's laboratory for technological upgrades, Sanji to Kamabakka Kingdom for new recipes and techniques, Zoro to Mihawk for swordsmanship training, etc. - each location perfectly suited to that member's role and abilities. This theory suggests Kuma, possibly working with Dragon and the Revolutionary Army, helped prepare the Straw Hats for the challenges of the New World while also protecting them from the World Government. The precision of where each member ended up seems too convenient to be coincidence.
author: r/OnePiece community

title: Nami Will Play a Crucial Role Against Uranus
summary: Theory that Nami's training on Weatheria and her eventual acquisition of Zeus will enable her to counter or control Uranus, the Ancient Weapon, during the final war.
fullText: A theory gaining traction in the One Piece community suggests that Nami's time on Weatheria and her weather manipulation abilities, combined with Zeus (Big Mom's homie that she later acquires), will be crucial in the final war, specifically in countering Uranus, one of the three Ancient Weapons. The theory posits that Uranus is likely weather-related or atmospheric in nature, and Nami's unique combination of Weatheria's science, Zeus's power, and her own natural talent will make her the only person capable of neutralizing this Ancient Weapon. This would elevate Nami's role from navigator to a key strategic asset in the final conflict. Some versions of this theory suggest Nami might even command Zeus to combine with sky islands like Weatheria to create a fleet or defense system for humanity.
author: Sportskeeda/One Piece theory community

title: Haredas and Vegapunk Connection
summary: Recent manga chapters have hinted at a connection between Haredas and Dr. Vegapunk, leading to theories about their shared past and collaboration on weather science.
fullText: One Piece Chapter 1125 revealed surprising connections between Nami's mentor Haredas and Dr. Vegapunk, leading to fan theories about their relationship. The theory suggests that Haredas and Vegapunk may have worked together in the past, possibly both being from the scientific community that researches ways to help humanity. Some fans speculate that Weatheria's technology might have been influenced by or collaborated with Vegapunk's work, or that both scientists share a common philosophical goal of using science for the betterment of people rather than for war. This connection adds new significance to both Nami ending up on Weatheria and Franky ending up at Vegapunk's old laboratory - suggesting these locations are more connected than initially apparent.
author: OtakuKart/One Piece community
